content: c c beanie redux designed by lea stern this is a copycat hand knitted version of the c c beanie that is commercially available it was originally designed as a ponytail hat with a single layer brim but evolved to be more like the original beanie with a folded brim and closed at the top it s a very comfortable hat that fits many heads in the single size it s designed in because of its mostly rib structure if you do want to make it smaller or larger just cast on multiples of two stitches to accommodate the 1 x 1 rib materials 160-200 yards worsted weight yarn yarn used in the photographs is spud & chloe sweater worsted super wash 55% wool - 45% organic cotton 160 yds/145 m if you choose to alter the size you may need more or less yarn needles us 7/4 5 mm 16 circular and a set of double pointed needles or preferred method for working in the round gauge 5 sts/inch in twisted rib on us #7 cast on using the provisional crochet method and waste yarn cast on 86 stitches join for knitting in the round place marker to mark beginning of round brim set up row k 1 p 1 around next row work k1 p1 twisted rib twisted rib is done by knitting through the back loop p1 repeat this row for 3 5-4 or to desired length remembering that the folded brim will be half this length when twisted rib brim is desired length place the live stitches from the provisional cast on onto another 16 circular needle of similar or smaller size fold the brim up to the inside of the hat and k2tog with the stitches on the main needle to create a folded brim knit one row body of hat *work 4 row purl knit one row work 4 row k1 p1 rib not twisted knit one row* repeat from * to * 2 times more crown knit 4 row next row decrease row ssk around 43 stitches knit 3 row next row decrease row ssk around to last stitch k1 22 stitches knit one row next row decrease row ssk around 11 stitches note the use of ssk for the decreases instead of k2tog creates a more consistent fabric with little to no space between the decreased stitches you can certainly use k2tog if preferred cut yarn leaving a tail and place yarn on a tapestry needle thread the yarn through the live stitches and close the hole by drawing the stitches up firmly weave in ends on wrong side abbreviations k1 knit one p1 purl one k1tbl knit one through the back loop k2tog knit two together ssk slip slip knit copyright 2021 lea stern all rights reserved pattern for personal use only designer can be contacted at knitdoc@yahoo com
